Whether it's monitoring the execution of strategies and programs, preparing briefs and presentations for diverse audiences, or working in data-driven projects, I've been able to materialize challenges that result in practical solutions. 

Analyst, innovative, passionate and hardworking are some of the characteristics that better describe me. I am driven by sustainable development, innovation, business development and international affairs. I studied Finance and International Relations and have pursued postgraduate studies in State, Public Policies and Development, and in Organizational Communication.

I've spent the past 9 years working for the Colombian Public Sector, but my passions also include volunteering and learning. Currently, I am volunteer's leader at Make-A-Wish Colombia and until September 2021, was a fellow at Geek Girls Latam. Always looking for the next step!"]

Recomiendo ampliamente a Maca para que se sume a cualquier equipo de trabajo desafiante!!'], ['Marcos Lambolay', 'Software Engineer, artist and astrophysics enthusiast', 'Mi experiencia con Macarena Canosa ha sido mas que excelente, quiero enunciar hechos que vienen al caso de la recomendacion, y que se vean lo mas diferenciados de mi opinion personal, para que el lector saque sus propias conclusiones al leer esto, por lo cual voy a enumerar los hechos en mi interaccion con Macarena. - durante mas de 6 meses, sin que nadie se lo pidiera, estuvo activamente buscando contactos de entrevistas para que yo pueda hacer el cambio de trabajo que buscaba, un BUEN cambio - me dejo dispuesto su numero de celular, para tener rapido contacto con ella, tanto para saber noticias de nuevas busquedas como de feedbacks de entrevistas - me hizo seguimiento diario y recordatorios, lo cual puede ser frustrante dado que por el estres yo me olvidaba mucho. y a ella no le correspondia tomarse esta tarea, sin embargo lo hizo. esto es parte de lo que quiero exaltar: es persistente, laboriosa. - cualquiera recuiter pudiera haber abandonado antes, para que molestarse con alguien que hay que tomarse trabajo extra para que consiga un trabajo mejor?, y ella sin que nadie se lo diga o pida, siguio por motivacion propia de servicio profesional. Otra vez, en mi opinion, remarco la persistencia. - ante la situacion de stress y pandemia personalmente sucumbi a los efectos negativos de animo y ella me animo luego de cada entrevista, algo que cae en lo personal, pero cumple en el campo profesional de ayudar a que el candidato persista en las busquedas y encuentre una posicion, que consta de la meta profesional del recruiter, en este caso Macarena - habiendo pasado para una oferta pasado 5 instancias de entrevistas, y obtener una oferta muy precaria con respecto a la paga, en mi opinion bien pudiera ella haber dicho "marcos es una primma donna, no lo postulo mas a nada" lo cual no fue el caso y me entendio perfectamente porque rechace tal oferta - otros tantos hechos mas que aun no recuerdo para poner en detalle en palabras, pero apelo a la confianza del lector a que tome mi palabra, que la honro siempre Ahora si mi opinion y juicio particular, no solo es una profesional que va solo la "milla extra" como dirian en USA, sino que te corre la maraton hasta lograr el objetivo. Esto es basicamente persistencia, algo que no se encuentra mucho hoy en dia. Y vaya, CUANTA PERSISTENCIA, estamos hablando de mas de 6 meses haciendole seguimiento a un candidato!. Details: ['Juana Cervio', 'Senior Tech Recruiter @ FlixBus â€¢ Content Creator â€¢ Digital HR Trainer @ HumanosReales â€¢ IT Sourcing, Employer Branding, and Organizational Culture Consultant â€¢ Career Counselor â€¢ Crypto enthusiast', 'Buenos Aires, Provincia de Buenos Aires, Argentina']
About:
["Hi there! I am Tech Recruiter and Digital HR Trainer that loves to create content on social media ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ’» 
[She/Her/Ella]

My favorite topics are related to talent acquisition in tech, creative sourcing, career counseling, organizational culture, employer branding, career path, professional development, job placement/employability in IT, agile recruiting, anthropology, digital education, crypto/blockchain, and more!

Fan of videogames ğŸ®, social engineering, and crypto!

I am open to collaborations, especially in the crypto/blockchain industry!

I have an anthropological background, and I've been working in the software industry ğŸ’» since 2014, focused on IT talent research since 2018.

I am currently recruiting the best tech talent all around the world to work at FlixBus ğŸšŒ ğŸ’š, in Germany.

In this last couple of years, I've been advising companies from the US, Canada, Argentina, Colombia, Uruguay, Panama, Spain, and Germany that needed to recruit talent (mostly software engineers, tech leads, and other specialists) in LATAM and NA, leading a great team of IT Recruiters and Sourcers at Carryer, and doing some headhunting myself.

In 2020 I co-founded HumanosReales with the goal of training the future HR talent with the focus on the digital revolution, offering courses and specializations in areas such as Tech Recruiting, People Analytics, and Talent Branding. We are the creators of the first HR Bootcamp in Latin America âš¡

I also have experience as a career counselor, educator (tutor, mentor, and teacher), and some experience as a tech support agent, and freelance fraud/hacking analyst, and ethnographic/UX researcher.

ğŸ“ Since 2018 I am a Therapeutic Counselor (psychiatric orientation, University Institute of the Italian Hospital).
I studied Anthropological Sciences (sociocultural orientation, University of Buenos Aires), and I have a specialization in Design Thinking from the University of Virginia.

-

ğŸ’¬ Feel free to write me in English, Spanish, or Portuguese (I'm proficient in the first two languages, learning the third!)

juacervio@gmail.com

Details: ['Martin Borchardt', 'Founder & CEO at Henry (YC S20)', 'Argentina']
About:
['Martin Borchardt is the founder of Henry (backed by YCombinator) a startup that INVESTS in people, helping them to become software engineers, in exchange of a share of their future income.

Before founding Henry, Martin founded Nubi, a cross-border payment and remittance fintech company that developed strategic alliances with tech giants like PayPal and Transferwise. In this project and others, in which he actively participates as an Advisor, he suffered first-hand the pain of finding, hiring and retaining software engineers in Latin America (lack of talent).

After a year of learning and deeply understanding this problem, during which he held meetings with more than 200 executives or founders of technology companies in the region, he decided to dedicate his entire career to solve this critical "skills gap" and increase the technology talent base in the region.

Featured in:

https://techcrunch-com.cdn.ampproject.org/c/s/techcrunch.com/2020/12/03/henry-picks-up-cash-to-be-a-lambda-school-for-latin-america/amp/

https://forbes.co/2021/01/07/emprendedores/henry-quiere-sumar-mas-colombianos-al-mundo-de-la-programacion/

Details: ['Mateo NicolÃ¡s Salvatto', '23. CampeÃ³n Internacional de RobÃ³tica. Co-fundador & CEO @ Asteroid, creadores de la app HÃ¡blalo. Director de InnovaciÃ³n de ORT Argentina. MIT IU35, PKU Best Social Innovator. Autor de #LBDF, host de #10MPCEM. Argentino.', 'Buenos Aires y alrededores']
About:
['I was born in 1999 in Buenos Aires, Argentina, and was always passionate about technology. Thus, since I was a kid, I decided to get involved with it as much as I could.

My high school studies (at ORT Argentina), oriented in electronics, led me to carry out many interesting projects such as launching three experimental rockets or building robots that fight sumo autonomously.

Robotics became my passion. I am champion of Argentina's National Robotics League and, in 2016, together with a partner and our coach, we were international "Robotraffic" champions at the Technion Institute of Technology in Haifa, Israel.

But, after all this, something inside me told me that I could use all the technology I had learned to impact the world in a more useful and direct way.

And so, Hablalo was born: A mobile app to help people with communication disabilities.

Although I was extremely happy with Hablalo's success, I wanted it to grow and help more people, so I decided to found, together with a group of partners, a tech start-up dedicated to developing and supporting free life-changing products for people in vulnerable situations: Asteroid Technologies.

Thanks to our work at Asteroid, Hablalo already helps +145k people with different disabilities in 53 countries across the 5 continents, 100% free.

I also made my personal goal to use technology as an equalizing tool for everyone, not just for disabled people... That's why between 2017 and 2019 I collaborated with the Government of the Province of Buenos Aires thinking, developing and scaling projects and policies that helped improve the quality of life and technical learning skills of Buenos Aires' inhabitants.

Also, I believe it's essential to share all my acquired knowledge with as many people as possible, mostly with the younger generations. That is why I'm part of the ORT Argentina team as Head of Innovation, promoting, impulsing and developing the entrepreneurial skills of our students. I'm also the founder and one of the teachers at our successful entrepreneurship & innovation course, ORT Launchpad.

Meanwhile, I tour Argentina and the world offering motivational talks and technology oriented conferences, which have reached +10 countries and more than 75.000 people.

Finally, thanks to the work of these last years, I was recognized with important awards such as: MIT Humanitarian Innovator of the Year - Best Social Innovator, Peking University, China - Entrepreneur highlighted by the National Congress - Social Entrepreneur of the Year (EY) - among others.

For more info, visit www.mateons.com']

Details: ['Abiodun Mamora, FCCA', 'Executive Director, Finance | Business Growth Partner | Value & Culture Advisor', 'Lagos, Nigeria']
About:
["Abiodun Mamora is the Executive Director-Finance at Construction Kaiser Limited, a highly reputable construction company that builds for the most valuable private companies across Nigeria. In her cumulative five years of CFO experience at FimoRealty and Construction Kaiser Limited, she has supported CEOs for organizational transformation and improved business results.

Abiodun has a strong reputation for sensing what is going to happen to a company's financial and business health before it ever becomes obvious to others. Also, she is reputed for business partnership, strengthening financial controls, championing true value-based culture, and aligning business processes with corporate strategy, resulting in improved business performance.

She is an alumna of Daystar Leadership Academy, a Fellow of Association of Chartered Certified Accountant, holds a first-class Bachelor's degree in Applied Accounting from Oxford Brookes University, United Kingdom, a Bachelor's degree in Economics and most recently completed the Advanced Management Programme (AMP) at Lagos Business School. She would always say â€œI am enjoying the help of God by Christ Jesusâ€.

She currently serves on the board of Construction Kaiser Limited and is responsible for finance and product development. She also serves as an advisor to a few other startup companies pursuing growth, as an expression of her passion to see businesses develop structures and processes that support sustainable growth."]

Details: ['Nia Mahesa', 'Managing Partner at NMCo. Law Firm', 'Yakarta, DKI Jakarta, Indonesia']
About:
["Ms. Mahesa is the founder of NMCo. Law Firm. She received her Master in Business Law from the University of Pelita Harapan in 2015 with Magna Cum Laude predicate and her Bachelor of Law from the Catholic University of Atma Jaya in 2009.

Her early career in law started in 2009 at Suyanto Simalango Patria, a boutique law firm in Jakarta, where she was appointed to handle Banking, Telecommunication, and Real Estate clients.

Her passion for Real Estate led her to pursue her career with Ciputra Group from 2011 to 2014, where she was involved in their 1st Sub Holding as Corporate Legal Manager. She was responsible for the real estate broker, Century 21 Indonesia. She had the chance to develop 21 Property Academy, a law property academy, to knowledge the groupâ€™s marketing on the property transactions. She was actively contributing to AREBI (Asosiasi Real Estat Broker Indonesia) as one of their Code of Conduct committees.

A new challenge came to her when she was offered the position of Group Head of Legal of Astra Property Group (a subsidiary of Astra International Tbk) from 2014 to 2019.

She was involved in developing their commercial and residential projects such as Menara Astra, Anandamaya Residences, Asya, and Arumaya. As a property developer, she participated in REI (Real Estate Indonesia). She is well knowledgeable in land acquisition, strata title and certification, also inland, landed house, and building permits.

Aside from Ms. Mahesa's expertise in Real Estate, she is well experienced in General Corporate, Trade, Commercial Litigation, Restructuring, Insolvency, Bankruptcy Litigation, Intellectual Property, Medical Law, and Family Law in the Firm.

Ms. Mahesa is a current bar member of PERADI (Perhimpunan Advokat Indonesia) and actively participates in the barâ€™s activities."]

Details: ['Ramanuj Mukherjee', 'Built iPleaders, a blawg with 2 mil/m users & bootstrapped LawSikho to $3m+ revenue. Currently building an army of freelancers & paralegals from Asia & Africa to disrupt the 300 billion US legal industry.', 'Delhi, India']
About:
["I have reached the maximum number of connections I can have on LinkedIn. Follow me here for my best insights: https://twitter.com/law_ninja 

Are you trying to build your law practice? Download for free and read this first: https://lawsikho.com/book/flying-start/

Do you want to work with a tier 1 law firm? I have this resource for you: https://lawsikho.com/book/blueprint/index.html

I started online businesses in the legal domain like iPleaders.in, LawSikho.com, and Superlawyer.in and have been building them up over the last decade.

iPleaders blog was started way back in 2009, from our college and since then it has become one of the largest legal blogs in the world that cover legal issues relevant to common people. As of Nov 2018, we attract 1 million unique readers per month and growing very fast.

I also started lawsikho.com which is the leading online legal learning platform, offering courses with live online classes, lots of exercises, mentorship and hands on training to hundreds of lawyers, law students and executives every month.

I have started and shut down many businesses too, such as cliklawyer. You start succeeding when you're not afraid to fail again.

Looking for meaningful volunteering opportunities and platforms to connect with like minded people. If I can help you in any way, do not hesitate to drop me a line."]

Details: ['Ashish Mehta', 'Founder & CVO, Ethos Legal Alliance || Banking Law & Financial Institutions Practice Enthusiast || At Heart A Litigation Lawyer || Lifelong Learner', 'Mumbai, Maharashtra, India']
About:
['I started my independent Disputes Resolution Practice in 2010 and went on to establish Ethos Legal Alliance (ELA), a young, Corporate & Commercial Disputes Resolution Law Firm in 2018, backed by my diverse, intense and wide experience in Disputes Resolution Practice in Mumbai. I have 13 years of experience at the Bar. 

I have handled plethora of cases, before various Courts, Tribunals, Statutory & Regulatory Authorities, Commissions & Forums, which individually add up to a rich exposure in the entire spectrum of Disputes Resolution Practice. As a lead Counsel, to my credit, I have 25 reported Judgments in various Law Journals. I am enrolled as the Panel Counsel for the Union of India before the Bombay High Court since the past four years and in addition, I was the Special Public Prosecutor for the Income Tax Department, Mumbai Region, entrusted with launching Prosecutions. I represent Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) before District & Sessions Courts.

I have worked closely with various Central Ministries/Authorities/Departments, having advised and appeared for them before different Courts and Tribunals in path breaking and benchmark setting matters, involving complex and intricate questions of law.

8 Practice Areas, ELA focuses on, amongst others:-

Disputes Resolution
Insolvency & Restructuring
Banking & Finance
White Collar Crimes
Real Estate
Environment
Direct Tax
IP Litigation

ELA advises and represents leading Corporates, Banks, NBFC's, Business Houses, SME Clients, Government of India, Authorities & Prosecuting Agencies. We have a strength of 08 Associates (and rapidly growing), who are assigned specific practice wise Courts to attend and appear.

We are on a Mission to establish ELA as "The Most Preferred Mid-Size Corporate Disputes Resolution Law Firm" in India by 2025.

Appointed as Special Public Prosecutor for SEBI, Mumbai in October 2019']
Courses: ['Post Graduate Diploma In Alternative Disputes Resolution From NALSAR']

Details: ['Sajai Singh', 'Chair, IBA Technology Law Committee', 'Bengaluru, Karnataka, India']
About:
['Chair of the Corporate Commercial Practice at JSA, along with leading the Technology, Media & Telecommunication Practice.

Undertake transactional work with a focus on representing emerging Technology companies in areas of inbound investments into India, Venture Capital & Private Equity investments, Joint Ventures, strategic alliances and Mergers & Acquisitions.

For Venture Funding & Private Equity transactions, represented both funds and investee companies.

Represented clients in a cross section of industries including Media, Communication, Entertainment and BPOs (Business Process Outsourcing).

Assisted many international businesses and funds to funnel investments into India. These clients include established and high technology companies, internet start-ups, connectivity specialists, e-commerce ventures, conversion technology and technology based entertainment industries.

Conducting two professional skills development courses at the National Law School of India University in Bangalore - one on Negotiation Skills and another on Transactional Skills for lawyers.

Acting as the Vice-President of ITech Law (http://www.itechlaw.org/officials.htm), the International Technology Lawyers Association. India representative for ABA International, along with being the Co-Chair of the India Committee of ABA SIL. Chair of the International Sub-committee of the PE / VC Committee of the ABA Section of Business Law. Actively involved with TiE and ABA (American Bar Association) globally, and often speak at international events.

Recent Publications:
http://www.jsalaw.com/publications/search-article.aspx?name=Sajai%20Singh']

Details: ['Hemant Batra (Hekbat)', 'Lawyer | Public Policy Advocate | Author | Special TV Host - Guest Anchor | Arbitrator | Counsel | Faculty |', 'Delhi, India']
About:
['Hemant Batra is a globally reputed constitutional, corporate, commercial, and public policy lawyer and counsel with nearly 30 years of experience. He is also a mediator, arbitrator, author, writer, and speaker. He was enrolled as an Advocate with the Delhi Bar Council in 1991. 

He joined the legal profession in 1991 as a litigation lawyer. Thereafter, with the progression of economic liberalisation in India, he ventured into a whole time law chamber practice by predominantly rendering expert legal opinions and undertaking legal documentation on complex international and domestic legal/public-policy issues. Currently, he is an independent arguing counsel.

He is the elected vice-president of SAARCLAW (South Asian Association for Regional cooperation in law), a regional apex body of SAARC established in 1990, and being the longest serving Secretary General of SAARCLAW i.e. almost 10 years in the past. SAARC is an inter-governmental diplomatic body of 8 South Asian nations. He had been associated with various projects of UNDP, UNAIDS, UNESCAP, and ADB. His profile is independently covered by Wikipedia, the largest and most popular multilingual online encyclopedia and reference work.

He was awarded prestigious Mahatma Gandhi Seva Medal by the Gandhi Global Foundation for effectively connecting legal communities of the SAARC nations. He is a mentor at several prestigious schools of business and an elected lifetime member of the general Assembly of the Union of International Association (UIA), a research institute and documentation centre, based in Brussels. The UIA has consultative status with ECOSOC and associate status with UNESCO. He is a co-founder of an international law and policy think-tank, Goeman Bind HTO.

He is a distinguished writer with seven diverse books to his authorship. His two latest books on `Due Diligence: In Business & Asset Acquisitionâ€™ and `Mediation: Legitimacy & Practiceâ€™ have been published by a leading law publisher, Eastern Book Company. He wrote his first book in 2004 titled SAARC.

He is a visiting guest speaker at various international universities and institutions. Until 2020, he has spoken as a speaker at more than 175 international conferences, seminars, and workshops on varied topics of commercial importance. He has travelled extensively around the world including Australia, Austria, Bhutan, Czech Republic, Germany, Holland, Hungary, Indonesia, Kuwait, Mauritius, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Philippines, Russia, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Thailand, UAE, UK, US, Vietnam and more.']

Details: ['Ritvik Lukose', 'Co-Founder and CEO - Vahura & Co-Founder and Director - Counselect', 'Bengaluru, Karnataka, India']
About:
['Ritvik Lukose, is the Co-Founder and CEO of Vahura (www.vahura.com) - the leading specialist Legal Search and Consulting firm in India. 

A graduate of the National Law School, Bangalore, Ritvik practiced corporate law at Amarchand Mangaldas, with a focus on private equity, capital markets and structured finance.

In 2007, he left the law to co-found Rainmaker (www.rainmaker.co.in), a pioneer in training and education services to the legal domain. Rainmaker, among other things, designed and ran India's first ever nation-wide bar exam for lawyers - the All India Bar Exam.

Ritvik exited Rainmaker in 2013, to lead Vahura (www.vahura.com) - the leading legal & governance recruitment and consulting firm in India. Vahura's purpose is "To help lawyers do good work", and with that aim, Vahura helps lawyers and legal services providers, grow organically and inorganically through a range of services and products.

Ritvik is also Co-Founder and Director of Counselect (www.counselect.com), a pioneering provider of legal secondment services in the region.

Ritvik is on the Advisory Board of the Centre for Advanced Mediation Practice (http://www.campmediation.in/) and training to be a commercial mediator. As a lawyer and entrepreneur, Ritvik is a passionate advocate of mediation as a means of resolving issues swiftly and effectively, with parties in control of the process and solutions.

He blogs irregularly on Entrepreneurship, Work and Life at http://ritviklukose.wordpress.com and tweets occasionally @ritviklukose

Specialties: Talent Management, Consulting, Business Strategy, Recruitment, Mediation and Corporate Legal Advisory']

['I joined LawSikho after a decade of working in and leading in-house legal and compliance teams in large and small multinationals and handling transactions like initial public offering, takeovers and winding up in India, Ireland and UK. At LawSikho, I have been instrumental in building the content team from scratch (currently, over 60 team members), curating the content for over 20 courses (lost count of how many articles I have written and edited - 1500 is a very conservative number).

I have also successfully curated and delivered training programs for organizations like ICICI Bank and Advaita Legal.

Currently a significant part of my day goes in helping startups go through with their legal formalities on one hand and guiding my students on the industry requirements on the other.']

Details: ['Eran Kahana', 'Cybersecurity, AI and IP Attorney | Fellow, Stanford Law School | Co-Author: The Law of Artificial Intelligence & Smart Machines', 'MineÃ¡polis, Minnesota, Estados Unidos']
About:
["I am a cybersecurity and intellectual property lawyer as well as a Fellow at Stanford Law School and a member of the Advisory Board of Stanford Law Schoolâ€™s Stanford Artificial Intelligence & Law Society.

In my practice, I counsel clients on a wide variety of matters related to cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, privacy, technology law, trademarks, patents, and copyright issues. I also serve in a variety of cybersecurity thought-leadership roles and work closely with the FBI, Department of Justice, Secret Service, and colleagues from the private and academic sectors to set, promote, and sustain cybersecurity best practices.

At Stanford Law School, I write and lecture on the intersect between law and artificial intelligence and am a frequent speaker at Stanford's annual Digital Economy Best Practices Conference. I have been cited in Oxford University Professor Marcus Du Satoyâ€™s book The Creativity Code: Art and Innovation in the Age of AI and also interviewed on artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, privacy, and technology law by Bloomberg Law, BBC, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) radio, KABC radio, Minnesota Public Radio, Twin Cities Business magazine, Star Tribune, TheStreet.com, Quartz magazine, and Stanford University Radio, KZSU FM.

I am also a certified martial arts instructor in Bujinkan Budo Taijutsu and an avid motorcyclist."]

Details: ['Sam Miller', 'Founder The Fine Art Ledger ; Corporate Finance Attorney at Rimon P.C.', 'Los Ãngeles, California, Estados Unidos']
About:
['I am a corporate and commercial transactional attorney, and a member of Rimon P.C.â€™s corporate finance team, based in its Los Angeles office. 

My specific focus is blockchain, NFTâ€™s and fine art. 

I am also founder of The Fine Art Ledger, the blockchain fine art platform that works to connect physical works of art to NFTâ€™s.

As intensively involved in the building and development of The Fine Art Ledger, I have specific experience in the operation and functionality of smart contracts, and the interface with and structure of NFTâ€™s , including all associated metadata content, constructs and storage.

I also work with token driven and asset based blockchain businesses, helping them deal with securities, money transmitter, money laundering and other regulatory requirements, contractual relationships, as well as gearing their platforms to deal with industry requirements and concerns.

I am licensed to practice law in, and have practiced in California, England and in South Africa, and have both extensive in-house and law firm experience.


M&A is also a core feature of my practice, advising on transactions for businesses in multiple US states and international jurisdictions

I have advised on corporate deals, commercial contracts and general corporate matters for clients in a range of countries over the last seventeen years, including England, Spain, France, Turkey, Lithuania, Latvia, United Arab Emirates, Israel, South Africa, Hong Kong, South Korea and the United States, with core industry involvement in the metals, technology, fine art and transportation sectors.


I have also had particular experience in supply and distribution, working with manufacturers, suppliers and distributors on international and domestic supply-chain transactions.

Before returning to private practice, I established and led the legal department of Kloeckner Metals Corporation, the third largest metals service center in North America, comprising Namasco Corporation, Macsteel Service Centers USA and other subsidiaries, and prior to that I worked as an M&A solicitor in the leading City of London firm Berwin Leighton Paisner LLP.']

It really pays to have a lawyer who has an appreciation for the business needs! Highly recommended!'], ['Albert Haber', 'Vice President Revenue Management at The Parking Spot', "I've worked closely with Helen in different capacities over the years at JetBlue Airways. She has always been a reliable person I have the utmost respect for. Helen keenly understands how to balance her legal responsibilities with carrying forth the vision of the Commercial team. She's quick to point out where the risks are and then offer up an alternative solution. Her down to earth attitude is refreshing for a lawyer! From the Revenue Management team perspective, her guidance on fare advertising, various promotional offers, sales, and any never-been-done-before thing JetBlue could think up was in good hands. While with the Financial Planning & Analysis group I often interacted with Helen on various Commercial negotiations and found Helen's quick grasp of the legal ramifications and brand impact impressive. She also proactively reviewed items and pointed out issues before they became issues. I would welcome any opportunity to work with Helen in the future as I've come to count on her as a steadfast and knowledgeable professional."], ['Mina Kursulic Alexander, SPHR, SHRM-CP (She/Her)', 'Vice President, People at Voice', "I've had the great pleasure of working with Helen at MRY. Helen is extremely knowledgeable of the law and its application to the advertising and marketing industries. When she joined MRY, which is a fast-paced agency, she hit the ground running and didn't miss a beat. Helen is professional, detail-oriented, has an incredible work ethic, but is also helpful, kind and all around great person. Helen would be an asset to any company."], ['Louise Delfino', 'Managing Associate General Counsel - Global Lead lawyer for GLCM Digital, Customer Platforms, Digital Payments', 'It was a pleasure to work with Helen. She has a friendly helpful manner and the clients were always very positive about the experience they had when Helen advised. My experience of Helen was that she was very detailed and knowledgable but still demonstrated a pragmatic and commercial attitude.'], ['Eric Leahy', 'Head of Human Resource Services at Catholic Schools Office, Diocese of Broken Bay', 'Helen is a great advocate and strong communicator. She demonstrated these skills by appearing in the Industrial Relations Tribunal, contributing in meetings and preparing letters of legal advice. She is also a thorough legal researcher and assisted me with such matters as the interpretation of state awards, employment agreements, unfair dismissals, transmission of business issues and executive employment matters. If you require legal advice, I would recommend Helen.'], ['Jeramy Cooper-Leavitt', 'Sr. Director, Cyber Security Operations and Threat Vulnerability Management at Aventiv Technologies', 'I can honestly say that it is a pleasure to work with Helen Wu as our legal counsel at HotelClub. Helen is a hard worker and very ambitious. She is a great communicator and has a good understanding of the legal challenges that we face (business contracts, privacy law, etc.) for our industry. Helen stays on top of the latest developments, legal trends and risks that face our company. She is clearly an asset to any organization that is lucky enough to have her working for them!'], ['Kappy P.', 'Cloud / DevOps / Entrepreneur', 'Helen has always assisted me in all Legal matters relating to IT within HotelClub part of Orbitz WorldWide (especially copyrighting, fraud, piracy, T&Cs, and Audits) i found her to be friendly, easily approachable and always willing to give her expertise always explaining it in simple and yet descriptive detail without all that lawyer talk. I would highly recommend Helen for any roles she may apply for and would work with her again in the future.'], ['Nicolas Patrick', 'Partner, DLA Piper', 'I worked with Helen during her time at Phillips Fox. I always enjoyed working with her. She is a great lawyer with strong attention to detail, a commercial approach and a positive attitude. I would happily recommend her to prospective employers.'], ['Mark Hasson', 'Experienced Senior Finance Professional', 'Helen was always very detailed and thorough in her review of any legal matters while she also views matters from a commercial stand point enabling her to ensure that these are dealt with practically and expeditiously. It was also great working with Helen in her role as Company Secretary as she maintained strict control ensuring that all compliance deadlines were met. Helen always acts professionally and is enjoyable to work with at the same time.'], ['Gerry Thorley', 'Director/Owner Maxan Investments; Co Founder Digital Place Solutions;', 'While Helen did not report to me directly there were regular and various projects that required Helen to brief me and very regularly provide recommendations as well. Helen always undertook her duties with absolute vigour and discipline. She was able to provide clear and succinct reports (or presentations) and was comfortable dealing with various reporting levels at any given time. I have no hesitation in vouching for Helen regarding her time at EYE.']]

Details: ['Idit Arad', 'General Counsel at Rakuten Viber, CIPP/E', 'West End, Inglaterra, Reino Unido']
About: ["As Rakuten Viber's General Counsel (Exec) I lead the company's legal, compliance and government relations functions across all jurisdictions. \n\nPrior to joining Rakuten Viber, I was providing legal advice on commercial and corporate matters as well as investment and M&A transactions, to a variety of clients, particularly in the tech industry."]

Details: ['Zabi Yaqeen', 'Founder and President at Muuvment. Member of the Law Society of Ontario.', 'Toronto, Ontario, CanadÃ¡']
About:
['Since 2014, my work has been dedicated to using media and technology to raise awareness of pressing social problems and building campaigns that generate measurable impact. Prior to that, I worked for 8 years as a commercial litigator and entertainment lawyer. 

In my role at Wishing Step Pictures, I produced and co-wrote the feature documentary film The Price of Cheap, which we started in August, 2014 and is being released in 2021. The film examines the hidden lives of the forced labourers who make our clothes. We follow their fight for justice against corruption, inequality and the fashion industry. I volunteer as duty counsel at Artistsâ€™ Legal Advice Services and as executive director of The Abolish Foundation.

I am a founder and the president of Muuvment.com, a technology platform that helps employees lead healthier and more purposeful lives. We soft-launched in January, 2021 and over the coming months, we look forward to sharing how weâ€™ve reimagined supporting health and purpose through unique interactive experiences and actions that generate measurable impact. Over the next couple of years, we plan to make our media and tech tools available for free to the public.

In 2021, me and my colleagues at Muuvment are going to continue to focus on our keystone habit which is to consider how we can help individuals and organizations generate meaningful and measurable impact in every decision we make.']

Details: ['Amr Wageeh (Amr M. M. Elsayed) LLM, ICDL, MCP, GC Powerlist, CEFDI.', 'FDI Expert | Public Policy | Foreign Trade | Government Affairs | Governance| Procurement | Contracts Management| Economic Zones', 'Kuwait']
About:
['Amr is a General Counsel & FDI policy adviser with a demonstrated history of working in the investment management industry, he has more than 20 years of extensive legal experience in Corporates, he has a fundamental understanding of the issues confronting global Corporations and Governments. 

His cross-border legal and business experience has been recognised globally by The Legal500 for helping to drive business growth with a focus on the GCC and Middle East markets.

The Doing Business Team in The World Bank Group appreciated his knowledge and expertise as one of the Contributors who participate in the development of the Doing Business indicators.

Amr has in-depth knowledge and expertise in â€œFDIâ€, Corporate Governance, Offset Program and Economic Zones. Skilled in Negotiation, Operations Management, Securities, Document Drafting, and Business Intelligence. Strong legal professional with a Master of Laws â€“ LLM focused on Private law - Investments & International Trade.']

Mr. Wageeh's strong sense of organization helped him to always gain the upper-hand in the competitive business environment. I am pleased to recommend Mr. Wageeh as a prominent legal counsel, I believe his work will not only meet but exceed the expectations for his respective position."], ['Tarek Yehya', 'Partner at Meysan Partners', 'While advising the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority on the feasibility study for the establishment of three special economic zones in Kuwait, I had the chance to work closely with Amr Wageeh, a senior legal advisor at KDIPA who was responsible for the review of our deliverables in the project. Throughout the course of our work on the project that spanned over a period of 18 months, Amr was a great person to work with and was also an important player in all the legal deliverables. Amr provided relentless guidance through the various regulatory, Governmental and legal matters relying on a solid legal knowledge and a vast track record in dealing with Government institutions through debating, negotiating and closing some of the most valuable agreements among Kuwaiti Government institutions.'], ['Khaled Talaat', 'Country General Manager at IBM Kuwait', 'Amr Wageeh was one of the most dedicated professionals through his work at KDIPA; he supported us in the establishment of IBM Entity in Kuwait. Details: ['Sean Hayes', 'Top 100 Rated Intâ€™l Lawyer. 20+ yes. experience. Led Dispute Resolution Law Firm of Year. Former Korean government officer, professor, columnist & U.S. Senate staffer. Proactive & Street-Smart Intâ€™l Business Professional', 'Nueva York, Nueva York, Estados Unidos']
About:
["Sean, a top rated international lawyer, is engaged in legal and business projects in New York, Korea, China, Hong Kong and Southeast Asia. Sean Hayes is the first non-Korean lawyer (NY Attorney) employed by the Korean Courts and one of the first non-Koreans to be a full-time regular member of a Korean law faculty. He spends his time between New York, Manila, HK and Seoul.

Sean managed a team that was ranked the Dispute Resolution Firm of the Year by two different publications. Sean is ranked a Top 100 Lawyer and LawAsia has rated Sean as one of only two non-Korean lawyers as a Leading Attorney. He is, also, regularly rated a Top Attorney in Arbitration, IP, Franchising, Dispute Resolution and Corporate Compliance for various legal rating services and is regularly quoted by the Wall Street Journal, NY Times and other leading news sources.

Sean is known, for his aggressive advocacy, proactivity, strategic approach to the legal and business challenges and candid NY-style street-smart advice.

Sean is, also, one of a few legal professionals that has experience managing non-consulting companies. He worked as an interim General Manager/HR Manager for Oil & Gas, New Tech, Pharmaceutical, Franchise and Manufacturing companies.

Sean regularly appears in and is quoted by international media organizations including the NY Times, Wall Street Journal and international law journals.

Sean is a New York Bar Member
Sean is member of the Int'l Bar Association."]

Details: ['Mishi Choudhary, Esq.', 'Technology, Privacy, Open Source, Policy, CIPP/E, CIPP/US|Managing Partner| Legal Director|Founder SFLC.in', 'Nueva York, Nueva York, Estados Unidos']
About:
["I solve problems for clients building new products and businesses in the U.S. and in India. Quickly learn new technologies and their challenges. Passionate privacy and Open Source professional working with tech companies to build privacy products and create privacy policies that protect user data. I use this knowledge to help policy makers make better regulation and policies to build Pro-Privacy IT for Humanity.

Found and built a legal services organization working on law, technology and policy, SFLC.in while running a law practice.

Recognized globally as a thought leader in technology policy matters including Intermediary Liability, Privacy, Data Protection, Copyright, Patents, Network Neutrality and Open Source Strategy.

Gallup's strengths Finder: Strategic, Individualization, Activator, Significance, Command.

Fifteen years of experience in broad base of substantive law relating to high technology companies and experience with technology policy issues, regulatory and self-regulatory regimes. Open Source Software licensing and compliance, Information Technology Laws, Data Protection laws (including state and federal consumer protection and privacy laws, GDPR, CCPA and other global laws), Privacy, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence , FinTech, software patents, export control compliance, domain names, ethics, internal investigations and employee relations issues, developing internal policies, Codes of Conduct, employee agreements.
Practice includes North American and Asian legal systems. I am the only lawyer in the world simultaneously to appear on briefs in the US and Indian Supreme Courts in the same Term.

In 2010, I found SFLC.in, a legal services organization to advance digital rights through strategic litigation, policy and advocacy in India. SFLC.in has now become the premier non-profit organization representing the rights of Internet users in India. It is instrumental in public-policy making on all issues of law,technology and policy. Built an extensive litigation practice that includes several landmark judgments on internet free speech, privacy, encryption, right to information. Extensive experience managing policy campaigns and strategic outreach with stakeholders including managing strategic outreach initiatives and policy campaigns to advance the values and interests of general public. A regular speaker on the global conference circuit, I write regularly in national and international publications.

Admitted to Practice in India and New York."]

Recommendations: [['I.P. Park', 'President of LG Sciencepark, Chairman of LG Group Technology Council', "Alyssa is a world class business-focused attorney, intellectual property expert and business executive, and I am very pleased to have worked with her closely during my tenure at Harman as CTO. Alyssa literally built from scratch Harmanâ€™s intellectual property strategy, and is credited to have dramatically increased the IP portfolio in quantity and in quality. Furthermore, she created and executed the IP monetization strategy for Harman, which has now become a significant technology and brand licensing business for Harman. This was possible because of her ability to work with and lead the technology teams, product teams and the business teams. While at Harman, I witnessed Alyssa put a focus on aligning intellectual property with the business and credit her with the following: 1) developing cross-divisional and cross-functional patent committees which resulted in increasing the patent portfolio by over 150%; 2) creating with the Lifestyle Audio division a technology and brand licensing program that generated additional revenue for Harman's business; 3) implementing a patent portfolio optimizing strategy that resulted in higher visibility of Harman's technological diversity and breadth across the company; 4) incorporating intellectual property reviews and strategies into Harman's business and M&A transactions; and 5) overseeing and managing a strategy for handling complex IP litigation. Alyssa also showcased her leadership ability at Harman by serving as a role model to her team of over 20 attorneys, paralegals and IP specialists, serving as a co-sponsor of the Harman Women's Network and being chosen as one of a select group of Harman executives to work on developing new business initiatives at the company. In summary, Alyssa is a super talented, experienced, and extremely dedicated executive who always delivers top results. She is also a very pleasant and fun person to be around. I enthusiastically recommend her for any legal, technology, business related executive position."], ['Caroline Wong', "Chief Strategy Officer at Cobalt | Humans of InfoSec Podcast | Security Metrics, A Beginner's Guide | The PtaaS Book", "The work that the global information security team does with vendor partners is typically custom development where a lot of smart folks are turning a great idea into reality. Alyssa provided my team with specific guidance on complex contracts often involving intellectual property and investment and ownership issues. I've always felt comfortable trusting her to alert my team to issues that we may not have caught ourselves, and provide great recommendations based on what we're trying to accomplish."], ['Natasha Gurevich', 'Chief Procurement Officer at Nike', "Alyssa and I have developed from scratch and completed 27 agreements in 7 months, and I can confidently attest that Alyssa is one of the strongest attorneys I've ever worked with. Her outstanding knowledge of contractual law and amazingly creative mind allowed eBay team to frame our business aspirations in a formal language benefiting both our team and our suppliers. Alyssa is a brilliant negotiator - calm, persistent, knowing when to insist and when to let go. She sees solutions where others see problems, and that makes her uniquely positioned not only as an attorney but as a strategic thinker and operational lead. I'd recommend Alyssa to any organization looking for a Senior attorney with the strong understanding of Strategy and Business Development."], ['Ted Gizewski', 'Zoom Deputy General Counsel', 'Alyssa is a highly skilled attorney and excellent negotiator. She provides pragmatic, business-oriented legal advice, and helps her clients develop creative solutions to complex business and legal issues. Alyssa is highly adept at defining and executing on legal strategies that support her clients, while building mutually beneficial customer relationships.'], ['Alida Rincon', 'Principal', 'Alyssa develops outstanding relationships with internal clients. She is service and relationship oriented and provides top notch legal advice. She demonstrates dedication and hard work for every project. Alyssa has extensive experience in multiple areas, including deep knowlege of open source issues and all aspects of contract negotiation.'], ['Becky Scott', 'Division Director - Communications, Publishing, Research at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints', 'I have had the pleasure of working with Alyssa for the past year or so at eBay Inc. We worked together on a few different projects that including extensive contract writing, negotiation and planning for third party vendors. Alyssa exhibited nothing but the utmost in professionalism at all times during all of our interactions. Her negotiation abilities are profound in that she understands the value of silence and the timing of a properly place comment. She moves fluidly from legal counsel jargon to patiently explaining complex legal concepts in laymans terms. She understands who she is representing and puts in a great deal of effort to ensure she is representing them accurately. Addtiionally, Alyssa has extensive knowledge in her field. I cannot not write a recommendation strong enough to amply communicate her level of expertise in the legal realm. In addition to extraordinary professionalism she has a human touch. She is approachable and forges valuable friendships as she gets the job done. Alyssa will be a great addition to any company and eBay was lucky to have her on their side.'], ['Andrew Miller', 'Public Company Board Member and Audit Committee Chair; Accomplished Technology Executive', "Alyssa was one of the strongest members of Autodesk's legal team and her tremendous competence and commitment made her a pleasure to work with as well as someone you could count on to deliver great results. She possessed a unique ability to balance business risks and objectives and legal risks and concerns, enabling her to function as a great legal partner. She is principled with a strong and balanced point of view."]]

I met her at the AmCham EU in Brussels and she was great in exchanging information and working together to develop better positions on privacy related issues.'], ['Carsten Hess', 'Partner at Avisa Partners, Founder, CEO at CHESSEUROPE srl, Co-Founder & Business Angel @GrandChess Arts & Entertainment', 'Ulrika is a great expert on European privacy legal and regulatory issues with an extensive network both to business and public affairs. I met her through shared work in AmCham EU in Brussels and had extremely useful exchanges of information and discussions on developments in EU data privacy policy-making after having joined Deutsche Post DHL.'], ['Bojana Bellamy', 'President, Centre for Information Policy Leadership at Hunton & Williams LLP', "Ulrika has a great combination of opertaional data privacy experience and policy work. Details: ['Robert Bond', 'Solicitor, Notary Public and Compliance & Ethics Professional', 'Sidmouth, Inglaterra, Reino Unido']
About:
['Robert Bond is a Solicitor and Notary Public and a Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional. He is a legal expert and author in the fields of data protection, information security and cyber risks, e-commerce, computer games and technology and has specialised in data protection & information security law since 1983. His publications include Practical Commercial Precedents (Chapter W) and Negotiating Software Contracts. 

Robert is a Fellow of the Society of Advanced Legal Studies, a Companion of the British Computer Society, an Honorary Member of the Institute of Export. He is a Freeman of the City of London and a Liveryman of both the City of London Solicitorsâ€™ Livery Company as well as the Worshipful Company of Stationers and Newspaper Makers.

He is a Director and Honorary Solicitor of the City Livery Club, a Director and Council Member of The Notaries' Society, Company Secretary & Trustee of South West Grid for Learning, President and Board Member of the Society for Corporate Compliance & Ethics and the Health Care Compliance Association, Head of the Examination Board for the Practitioner Certificate in Data Protection, Chairman of the Governance Board of the Data Protection Network, a founder member of the UN Global Pulse Expert Group on Governance of Data and AI, and an Ambassador for Privacy by Design.

Robert is Listed as a Leading Individual in Legal 500 for Data Protection where he is described as "astounding" and in Band 1 for Data Protection in Chambers UK 2022 and where sources praise him his"very level-headed and pragmatic approach," as well as his "long-term experience and insight," explaining that he "delivers a commercially practical solution." He regularly advises leading multinationals on data protection, drawing on additional experience in technology and IP issues.

He is named in the DataIQ 2021 Data 100, named in the National Law Journal's list of 50 Governance Risk & Compliance Trailblazers, listed in "Who's Who Legal: Thought Leaders - Global Elite 2021", recognised for Information Technology in the Client Choice awards 2020, named as a Thought Leader in " Who's Who of Data Protection Lawyers 2020" and listed in "Best Lawyers in UK in the practice area of Information Technology Law 2022".']

Recommendations: [['Chuck Barry', 'A Senior Legal Counsel for Coloplast Corp. Global Commercial & Government Contracts Counsel for multiple business units', "Robert's command of EU Data Protection regulatory requirements and how to apply these by practical, simple explanations and policies and business practices that business executives can understand has been an exceptional art and skill that Proto Labs, Inc. benefited from when I retained Robert and his team to assist my team and the company in updating our data protection and cookies policies and business practices in 2014. In addition, his kindness and generosity in sharing what he knows so well made working with Robert a real enjoyable experience."], ['Monica Almeida', 'Dual qualified international privacy lawyer', 'I was fortunate to work with Robert during my time at Speechly Bircham. Robert is a great partner to work with, extremely supportive and very effectively mentoring his associates. His knowledge of all data protection, privacy and data security issues is extraordinary, and his experience with assisting clients in complex issues allows for commercially sensitive solutions for multijurisdictional data protection concerns.'], ['Chuck Barry', 'A Senior Legal Counsel for Coloplast Corp. Global Commercial & Government Contracts Counsel for multiple business units', 'Robert is a superb, trusted advisor and "architect" on EU, U.S., and other states data protection regulatory compliance requirements, policies, processes and systems with which companies can strive to improve their risk profiles in volatile times. In 2014, Robert and his team of associates did an excellent job in assisting my contracts and legal team in cost effectively planning and instituting uptodate data protection and "Cookies" policies and other guidance for current business needs and as strong foundation for future developments, when I served as the director of contracts and compliance at Proto Labs, Inc. (Proto Labs is a $163M quick-turn prototype and 3D printing manufacturer in Minneapolis, MN.) We appreciated very much Robert\'s and his associates capable and very responsive legal support and practical business insights to enhance our implementation of current data protection policies and practices. Chuck Barry'], ['Jack McLaren-Stewart', 'Co-Founder at Saorsa Group', 'I have had the pleasure of working with Robert in multiple capacities and to call him an expert in his field is a massive understatement. Not only is his knowledge of all things Data Protection-related unparalleled, but his willingness to share insights and advice has been hugely helpful on both a business and personal level. He continues to push boundaries in his field and Iâ€™d have absolutely no hesitation in recommending him to anyone seeking to learn more about the world of data protection, information security & cyber risk.'], ['Patrizia Bertini', 'Associate Director of Design Operations at Babylon Health', "Being in need for a professional legal advice, I've turned to Robert, knowing his outstanding reputation. I was extremely impressed by his helpfulness and have greatly appreciated his honest and sincere attitude and his highly competent and professional advices."], ['Oliver M. Habel, Dr. jur.', 'Managing partner tecLEGAL Habel RAe', 'I have worked with Robert Bond for a common client, corresponded in data protection matters, and had common legal presentations on international congresses of ITechLaw Association. Richard has a good technical understanding of the Internet, has an excellent legal knowledge in the field of Internet and law, is a fabulous speaker, and especially a very good colleague and friend, who has a broad international professional experience. I would recommend him in all Internet and data protection matters in UK. Oliver Habel, Munich, Germany'], ['RaphaÃ«l Dana', 'Partner at Dana AssociÃ©s (Paris Bar) dana.law', 'I have been working and co-writing articles with Robert since 2003 on various IT/IP/Privacy-related matters, and it has always been a tremendous pleasure. Seeing him handling files involving various countries has shown me how to act as a team leader with enthusiasm and efficiency. I look forward to many more years of collaboration!'], ['Emma Bartlett', 'Partner at CM Murray LLP', "Robert's experience and knowledge in the field of information technology is invaluable to any business, particularly an international or pan European one. It is rivalled only by his great enthusiasm and tenacity to resolve issues pragmatically and get to the heart of any concern."], ['James Evans', 'Associate General Counsel', 'Robert is clearly a real expert in his field - and in particular has an unrivalled knowledge of data protection law. He also has a great understanding of law in the context of magazines and online media. I have worked with Robert for almost five years and have always found him to be very personable.'], ['Omer Tene', 'Partner, Goodwin', 'Robert is a true leader in law and technology, with decades of experience at the forefront of the profession in IP, IT, data protection and security, outsourcing and more. He has a unique grasp of the technological aspects of regulation, including issues such as RFID and biometrics. He friendly and good humored and at the same time serious and hands-on. I have worked with Robert on several projects and strongly recommend him for any legal or policy engagement.'], ['Wayne Cleghorn', 'Chief Executive Officer & Practice Director at PrivacySolved', 'Robert has developed a reputation as a trusted specialist in IT/IP/Data Protection/Privacy. His webinars and legal updating services are very good and are much-loved by a wide range of in-house counsel and information professionals. He is approachable, very knowledgeable and is very much the gentleman advisor.'], ['Peter Kinsella', 'Partner at Perkins Coie LLP', 'Robert is a very capable attorney with a wealth of experience in intellectual property and privacy matters. He provides valuable guidance, good business judgment and a deep knowledge of the law. His positive attitude and high level of ethical integrity is evident in all of his interactions.'], ['Ceylin Beyli', 'Founder & Managing Lawyer at CBL Law Office', 'I first met Robert back in 2005 in Stockholm, during European Conference of ITECHLAW (which was called "CLA" back then). \'Til date, I had the opportunity, honour and delight to benefit from his broad information and experience in data protection and IT matters, to enjoy his speechs at the mutually attended conferences and to work together in projects. He is not only a very good lawyer with extensive knowledge in his field, but also a great colleague with a delightful sense of humour.'], ['Daniel Breston', 'Retiring after 50 years in IT! Volunteer board member of ITSMFUK, FBCS, FISM, and sharing knowledge as a blogger, or via webinars or at conferences!', 'Robert was recommended by the British Computer Society as someone who could offer advice in company start-up, data protection, IP, IT law strategies both in the UK and EU. I am glad I did not disbelieve this advice 6 years ago as his guidance and patience have helped me immeasurably.'], ["Tjerk t'Sas", 'Sales Leader France & BeNeLux at DXC Technology', 'Robert is a top professional who trained and motivated my team.'], ['PETER BROWN', 'Principal at Peter Brown & Associates PLLC "BrownTechLegal" We help businesses create, implement, arbitrate and protect technology', 'Robert is one of the leading lawyers in the U.K. in the fields of data security, computer games and IT law. He has a broad international reputation among technology lawyers and their clients. Robert is a thought leader on cutting edge technology issues and is a prolific author and lecturer. The IP/IT practice group at his firm, which he helped found, is one of the most dynamic teams in this field. I would strongly recommend Robert for any project that requires insight, creativity and technicial skill.'], ['Michael Doland', 'Abogado americano', 'Knowing Robert Bond through INTA and originally through the international group of legal counsel he formed in the 1990s, the consistent feedback from every client referred to him is fantastic. A thorough knowledge of his field and a great focus on giving value to multinaitonals doing business in the EC. Great communication skills with CEO, CFO and CIO level decision makers.'], ['Julian Heathcote Hobbins', 'Legal Counsel, License Compliance at Autodesk EMEA', 'Robert is one of the best in the field, thinking laterally in a commercial manner and expertly applying the law accordingly. First class attention to our needs in the organisation - need I say more.'], ['Enric Enrich', 'Alliance Partner at Croma-Copyrait', 'I have been working with Robert for a long time and he has always been very effective in all the services provided. I strongly recommend him if you need an expert in his field!'], ['Lisa Lister', 'culture-first, better business', 'Robert is an expert in the field of IT Law and data protection. He has a wealth of experience both internationally and in the UK. In addition, and I would say most importantly, he is an extremely nice guy.']]

Details: ['Laura S.', 'Senior Lawyer, ICSA qualified', 'Reino Unido']
About:
['16 PQE lawyer. Laura has 22 yearsâ€™ experience in law, compliance and governance and has held senior roles. As Head of Legal and Compliance at the international body for accounting standards, Laura supported the significant investment in enhancing and protecting its IP portfolio, translating its standards for use world-wide, on-boarding a large number of jurisdictions which through legislation or agreements were agreeing to use the standards and securing additional income.

Laura was a senior project manager at the UKâ€™s accounting standards body (FRC) managing risks to its income and new income being secured following the reduction of government funding. Laura then went on to be the sole corporate counsel at the UK membership body for actuaries where she supported the Board on internal and external arrangements during its re-structure and helped leverage key relationships on areas of joined interest including with the FCA and FRC.

More recently Laura was Senior Legal Counsel leading on data protection and privacy remediation, data licensing terms and exchange related investigations and remediation at one of the largest international brokerage businesses which is part of the Cantor group. Laura is currently a Senior Lawyer and Company Secretary at Open Banking Limited and is supporting the Board in governance changes that will affect how the organisation operates in future.

Details: ['Mark Radcliffe', 'Experienced Silicon Valley Corporate and IP Transaction Lawyer', 'Palo Alto, California, Estados Unidos']
About:
['I work with technology companies and companies that use technology throughout the world. I have been working in Silicon Valley for over 30 years. I particularly enjoy applying the law to the issues raised by new technologies, such as blockchain, open source software, IoT and domain names. My clients range from Fortune 500 such as Oracle Corporation and Sony Corporation to unknown startups. Currently, my team and I are working with over 50 startups. I have worked across a wide variety of industries, including software (in particular open source software), blockchain, IoT, semiconductor, consumer electronics, content licensing (from music to characters), and medical devices. During my career, I have advised companies and investors on over 1,000 venture capital transaction. The following are some of my projects:

Assisted several large companies in developing open source strategies

Started and manage the corporate venture capital practice at DLA Piper

General counsel to OSI and serve on Apache Software Foundation Legal Committee on a pro bono basis

General counsel to the OpenStack Foundation (open source cloud computing project)

Assisted the Navajo Nation in adopting a modified version of Article II of the UCC

Assisted blockchain startup in its licensing strategy

Assisted on ICOs

Assisted Network Solutions in developing the first domain dispute resolution policy in 1994 (still used in current ICANN Dispute Resolution Policy)

Assisted Dr. Suess Estate in determining what words, characters and symbols to register as trademarks

Assisted major corporation in obtaining a license from a financially troubled company with a $40M prepaid royalty and ensured that the license would survive bankruptcy

Assisted large Asian company in developing IP asset management strategy for its 50,000 patents


Specialties: Developing and implementing strategies to protect and exploit intellectual property for clients; venture capital financing; blockchain; and licensing.']

Details: ['Alex Hamilton', 'CEO of Radiant Law and author of SIGN HERE: the enterprise guide to closing contracts quickly', 'Londres, Inglaterra, Reino Unido']
About:
['Alex Hamilton is the CEO and founder of Radiant Law, the UK-based award-winning NewLaw firm, and the author of SIGN HERE: the enterprise guide to closing contracts quickly.

Alex spends much of his time working on improving the contracting process for clients and leads product and tech development. Alex is a qualified lawyer in England and New York and specialised in outsourcing, technology and commercial contracts when he used to do deals. Before founding Radiant Law, he was a Partner at Latham & Watkins and co-Chair of Latham & Watkinsâ€™ global Technology Transactions Group.

Twitter (where he shares stronger opinions than on LinkedIn): @alexhamiltonrad']

Details: ['Nigel Swycher', 'CEO, CIPHER', 'Reino Unido']
About: ['Cipher unleashes the strategic value of patents. Cipher enables patent owners to make rational decisions by providing strategic patent intelligence, powered by machine learning. Our Solutions are focussed on strategic decisions at the heart of patent strategy including portfolio optimisation, budget management, cross-licensing, monetisation and inbound patent assertion. When asked why I moved from a career in the law to patent analytics, my usual response is because life is too short to count patents manually.']

Details: ['Mark Webber', 'US Managing Partner @ Fieldfisher', 'San Francisco y alrededores']
About:
["As the US Managing Partner heading up the US operations of Fieldfisher I'm based full-time in Silicon Valley. I'm a European digital regulation and technology transactions lawyer. EU privacy and data laws underpin almost every transaction or issue I support. I hold the CIPP/E and am an IAPP Privacy Faculty Member.

I advise technology and IP-rich business on EU sales, licensing and online compliance issues. Particularly where there is a disruptive or online component to the proposed transaction.

With 18 years of experience advising on technology deals, I advise where cloud, digital and online technologies converge. When businesses leverage technology, IP and/or data to drive revenue they face the issues I specialize in. My practice is focused on internet, ecommerce, e-marketing and cloud/SaaS. Inevitably privacy and security, but wider digital regulation and contracting issues too. Where does EU regulation bite? How can the internet, online platforms, partnering, sales channels contribute to sales success and what legal issues or hurdles need overcoming?

Whether an emerging-growth or listed enterprise, when the decision to internationalize or scale internationally comes this inevitably leads a GC or senior management team to deal with unfamiliar legal regimes. For over 18 years Iâ€™ve worked alongside such individuals in FDI, investing, selling or licensing product or exploring online activities in the EU.

Itâ€™s my job to ease the international expansion, compliance and sales process.

I am registered with the California Bar to practise English and EU law as an Foreign Legal Consultant.

Specialties: Internet and online regulation (including privacy under the Directive and GDPR)
Cloud (IaaS and PaaS)
SaaS
Digital Media
Product counseling and launch compliance reviews
Innovative and Complex Technology Transactions
Inward Investment (into EU)
Sales Channels (structuring and implementation)
Ecommerce
EU Privacy Compliance"]
Recommendations:
[['Richard Finer', 'Experienced, ex-ViacomCBS, international Head of Legal, specialising in providing legal advice and commercial solutions to media, entertainment and tech businesses.', 'Mark is a highly experienced technology lawyer. From working with him it is clear that he has a genuine passion to be an early adopter of technologies, the knowledge from which he then applies to commercially astute legal advice. Whilst technology may be at the heart of his practice, he is also an exceptionally well-rounded commercial lawyer as well as being a very interesting and well informed person.'], ['Melanie Cole (Warman)', 'Owner and Principal Run Leader - Boobs on the Run / Kids on the Run', 'Mark is an exceptional individual within the field of law. To a person with little knowledge of law and process, he makes things very simple. He explained complex legal issues that the whole team would understand. 
 
Mark and his team were instrumental in delivering a comprehensive and solid contract that was beneficial to both parties. He put in many hours and effort to ensure it was completed on time.

Mark and his team were diligent and they all worked to very tight timescales, sometimes to the early hours of the morning.

I would recommend Mark for any legal contract negotiations I would undertake in the future.'], ['Suzette Tagg', 'Co-Founder and Director of Libratum | Professional Wellness Coach | Chartered Marketer (FCIM)', 'Mark is a true professional who offers sound advice. He is reliable, friendly and approachable and above all, he really knows his stuff!']]

Details: ['Noric Dilanchian', 'Managing Partner at DILANCHIAN | Lawyers & Consultants', 'SÃ­dney y alrededores']
About:
["Call for a conversation. | In my 38-year career in business and law my usual assignments involve building on the points of distinction of a client's venture (especially its intellectual property) and then contractually structuring the business and its ventures. Since 1983 I have had roles as an in-house counsel; solicitor in private practice in national, mid-tier and small law firms; and commercialisation consultant (in particular for new businesses, intellectual property and information technology products and services).

As a LEGALTECH INNOVATOR I have developed and maintain a documents database of thousands of contracts and related templates to deliver cost-effective advice. This reflects the value I give to CODE STANDARDISATION AND RE-USE and the application of multidisciplinary know-how for business functions, processes and workflows.

As an INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY AND IT LAWYER I advise on trade marks, brands, copyrights, confidential information, pre-filing patent applications, patent licensing, information and entertainment content, computer programs, inventions, formulations, courseware and business systems.

As a CONTRACTS LAWYER I have reviewed, prepared or advised on over 5,000 contracts. They include contracts for - internet ventures, software, content owners, food and beverage distribution, joint ventures, shareholders, employees, independent contractors, licensing, technology transfer, publishing, ecommerce, mobile apps and commercialisation.

Call for a conversation.

Noric Dilanchian | Managing Partner

Details: ['Rish Handa', 'Lawyer for Business | Technology and IP | Privacy and Cybersecurity', 'CanadÃ¡']
About:
["I practice in the following legal sectors: Corporate/Commercial | Technology | Privacy & Cybersecurity | Intellectual Property (IP) . I represent clients at all stages, from emerging companies to large enterprises. 

 â–ª Current projects: Privacy and cybersecurity developments, including Quebec's reformed private-sector privacy law (Bill 64).
â–ª Current topics of interest: AI and IOT.

My technology and intellectual property legal practice primarily includes advising clients with regard to IP licensing arrangements, SaaS agreements, commercialization and funding arrangements, and patent/copyright matters.

My privacy and cybersecurity practice includes advising clients with respect to privacy matters (federal, provincial, and international), anti-spam compliance, and cybersecurity standards. I also act as breach counsel for data security incidents.

My corporate/commercial practice primarily includes private acquisition and divestiture transactions, financings, and reorganizations, in addition to a variety of day-to-day commercial matters, including complex services arrangements.

Details: ['Emile Loza de Siles', 'Artificial Intelligence & Law Professor | Tech Lawyer', 'Washington, Distrito de Columbia, Estados Unidos']
About:
['Artificial Intelligence and law scholar. Law teacher. Deeply experienced and highly effective technology attorney with powerful law firm, law enforcement, and federal government experience with Fortune 500 clients, high tech start-ups, Federal Trade Commission, the U.S. Department of Commerce & other federal agencies. 

Extensive experience with global technology transactions, licensing, and intellectual property and commercial litigation. Intelligence expertise for federal and corporate enforcements, licensing compliance, and mergers and acquisitions.

Superior business leadership, financial management, and project and team management skills. Strong technology business and science business background in information technologies, optoelectronics, and healthcare.

Intensely-committed business focus. Personable, team player, self-starter. Business development.

Top-tier legal education; masters degree in business administration; technology undergraduate degree. English (native) and Spanish (fluent).

Exceptional intelligence, creativity, and critical thinking abilities backed by American Bar Association and other leadership. Legal scholarship in emergent intellectual property law, new media, entrepreneurship, and innovation. Expert writer with numerous publications.']

Details: ['Mladen Vukmir', 'VUKMIR & ASSOCIATES, LLC, Founding Partner', 'Zagreb, Condado de Zagreb, Croacia']
About:
['After completing the law education at Zagreb University Law School, Mladen obtained Master of Intellectual Property degree at Franklin Pierce Law Center in Concord (UNH), NH, USA. He started as an associate at Hanzekovic & Partners law firm in Zagreb and was a visiting lawyer at: Fenwick & West in Palo Alto, CA, USA; Monahan Duhot, Paris, France and Pavia e Ansaldo, Milan, Italy. In 1991 he founded VUKMIR & ASSOCIATES. Mladen is a patent and trademark agent, admitted to practice before the CSIPO, EUIPO and European Patent Office. During the Croatian EU accession negotiations he participated as an expert on enforcement in the IP Chapter Working Group. He advised on preparations for the Manual on Technology Transfer at UNIDO.

Mladen wrote numerous articles and lectured on various topics on intellectual property, including regular teaching as an adjunct lecturer at the University of Zagreb Faculty of Law graduate and postgraduate courses. He is an arbitrator on the Panel of domestic disputes at the Permanent Arbitration Court at the Croatian Chamber of Commerce, panelist on the UDRP Domain Name Panel at WIPO AMC, a distinguished neutral on the CPR Panels of Neutrals and at the INTA PON and is an IMI certified mediator. Mladen is a member AIPPI, ECTA, IBA, ITechLaw, GALA, INTA, LES, UIA & ABA.

Mladen also served as a consultant to various domestic and international organizations such as the Croatian Ministry of Science and Technology, Serbian Intellectual Property Office (PLAC), World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), the World Bank and the European Commission (CARDS 2002 and IPA 2009) and GLG Council.

He is Royal Danish Consul General (Hon.) in Zagreb (decorated, Knight of the Order of Dannebrog 2n degree).

Specialties: Intellectual property (copyright, trademark, design, business secrets, patent, geographical indications, unfair competition), IT, media and advertising, branding and identity strategies, ADR and mediation.']

Details: ['Gerard Stegmaier', 'Practical Problem Solver + Trusted Consigliere', 'Washington DC-Baltimore y alrededores']
About:
['Information is the asset class of the 21st century. I help dreamers become doers and help doers make and execute difficult decisions especially in crises.

I trained in law nearly 25 years ago and use this background to provide strategic and legal data-related advice.

I leverage my corporate governance and internal investigations background to serve as a trusted adviser to boards and executives on data security breaches, class actions and privacy and consumer protection-related investigations at agencies such as the SEC, FTC and state attorneys general.

I act as general counsel for and invest and advise in data-centric fast growth enterprises from idea to exit and beyond. My strategic transaction experience includes M&A transactions at transaction sizes ranging from under $100 million to several billion dollars. Venture capitalists, private equity sponsors, angels and founders count on me to help them develop, execute and defend data strategies.

I focus on digital health, technology, media, IP, security, online advertising, predictive analytics and machine learning and artificial intelligence matters.

I have game-changing experience acting as product counsel for new and emerging services in the digital health, Internet, Internet-of-Things, SaaS/cloud, adtech, location services and auto verticals and have worked on products and services loved by billions of consumers.

I routinely assist late-stage private companies to mature their processes and governance in anticipation of public offerings focusing on practical, actionable, cost-effective solutions.

Members of Congress, regulators and principals rely on my counsel and I have spoken before groups including Harvard Business School, Virginiaâ€™s Darden School of Business, Georgetown Law School and the United States Department of State. The Wall Street Journal, Washington Post, Fortune, CNN, Bloomberg and other media seek out my perspective.

I enjoy helping those I assist remain calm, solve difficult problems with new thinking and have fun -- especially when in crisis.']
